title: AfDB greenlights $27m loan for 200MW solar PV plant in Egypt
lead: The project is expected to lower electricity costs for businesses and residents

title: COP26 – ‘Government needs to have clearer ambitions and ways to measure success’
lead: A new report from BEIS has called for more clarity from the UK government to ensure the climate summit can be a success

title: ENA appoints new Chair for Open Networks Project
lead: Mr Sotiris Georgiopoulos, Head of Smart Grid Development at UK Power Networks, will oversee the project’s work and progress

title: Japanese trading house invests in UK CCS project
lead: Acorn CCS project aims to store carbon dioxide emissions in North Sea oil and gas reservoirs

title: Utility Team launches ‘gamechanging’ energy efficiency software
lead: Tests of the new software have shown it can reduce the energy usage of chiller systems by up to 20%

title: Oxford’s Zero Emission Zone set for approval
lead: The zone to tackle air pollution from transport is expected to launch in August this year

title: Demand for clean vehicles soars in weakest February for car sales since 1959
lead: One-in-eight registrations last month were for BEVs and PHEVs, a new report shows

title: New anaerobic digestion ‘toolbox’ launched for agricultural sector
lead: It provides information and makes tools available to help AD developers to prepare the evaluation and structuring of the basic economics of their projects

title: UK supports clean energy in Malawi with £2.1m grant
lead: Malawi has an electrification rate of just 18%, with only 11% connected to the grid and frequent power outages are affecting economic productivity

title: Masdar and EDF to explore renewable energy opportunities in Israel
lead: They will look to collaborate on existing renewable energy projects and those under development, whilst also exploring joint participation in new programmes announced by the Government of Israel
